outputdir: folder for saving the created files
template: template to use for file creation
AlphaNumericNameError: Name must contain only alphanumeric characters.
NameMustStartWithLetterError: Name must start with a letter.
EndWithUnderscoreError: Name can't end with an underscore.
ApexClassCommandDescription:
create an Apex class 
 If not supplied, the apiversion, template, and outputdir use default values.
The outputdir can be an absolute path or relative to the current working directory.
NameFlagDescription: name of the generated Apex class
MissingClassnameFlag:
Missing required flag:
 -n, --classname CLASSNAME  name of the generated Apex class
See more help with --help
ApexTriggerCommandDescription:
create an Apex trigger
 If not supplied, the apiversion, template, and outputdir use default values.
The outputdir can be an absolute path or relative to the current working directory.
triggername: name of the generated Apex trigger
sobject: sObject to create a trigger on
MissingTriggernameFlag:
Missing required flag:
 -n, --triggername TRIGGERNAME  name of the generated Apex trigger
See more help with --help
internal: create lightning components without creating a -meta.xml file
appname: name of the generated Lightning app
MissingAuraDir: Lightning bundles must have a parent folder named 'aura'.
LightningAppCommandDescription:
create a Lightning app
If not supplied, the apiversion, template, and outputdir use default values.
The outputdir can be an absolute path or relative to the current working directory.
If you don’t specify an outputdir, we create a subfolder in your current working directory with the name of your bundle. For example, if the current working directory is force-app and your Lightning bundle is called myBundle, we create force-app/myBundle/ to store the files in the bundle.
MissingAuraFolder: Lightning bundles must have a parent folder named 'aura'.
MissingAppname:
Missing required flag:
 -n, --appname APPNAME  name of the generated Lightning app
See more help with --help
LightningComponentCommandDescription:
create a bundle for an Aura component or a Lightning web component
If not supplied, the apiversion, template, and outputdir use default values.
The outputdir can be an absolute path or relative to the current working directory.
If you don’t specify an outputdir, we create a subfolder in your current working directory with the name of your bundle. For example, if the current working directory is force-app and your Lightning bundle is called myBundle, we create force-app/myBundle/ to store the files in the bundle.
To create a Lightning web component, pass --type lwc to the command. If you don’t include a --type value, Salesforce CLI creates an Aura component by default.
componentname: name of the generated Lightning component
MissingLWCDir: Lightning bundles must have a parent folder named 'lwc'.
MissingComponentName:
Missing required flag:
 -n, --componentname COMPONENTNAME  name of the generated Lightning component
See more help with --help
MissingLWCFolder: Lightning bundles must have a parent folder named 'lwc'.

create a Lightning event
If not supplied, the apiversion, template, and outputdir use default values.
The outputdir can be an absolute path or relative to the current working directory.
If you don’t specify an outputdir, we create a subfolder in your current working directory with the name of your bundle. For example, if the current working directory is force-app and your Lightning bundle is called myBundle, we create force-app/myBundle/ to store the files in the bundle.
eventname: name of the generated Lightning event
MissingEventname:
Missing required flag:
 -n, --eventname EVENTNAME  name of the generated Lightning event
See more help with --help

If not supplied, the apiversion, template, and outputdir use default values.
The outputdir can be an absolute path or relative to the current working directory.
If you don’t specify an outputdir, we create a subfolder in your current working directory with the name of your bundle. For example, if the current working directory is force-app and your Lightning bundle is called myBundle, we create force-app/myBundle/ to store the files in the bundle.
interfacename: name of the generated Lightning interface

ProjectCommandDescription:
create a Salesforce DX project
Default values are used if the template, namespace, defaultpackagedir, and outputdir aren’t supplied.
The outputdir can be an absolute path or relative to the current working directory.
manifest: generate a manifest (package.xml) for change-set based development
MissingProjectname:
Missing required flag:
 -n, --projectname PROJECTNAME  name of the generated project
See more help with --help
StandardReadMe: This guide helps Salesforce developers who are new to Visual Studio Code go
VisualforceComponentCommandDescription:
create a Visualforce component
If not supplied, the apiversion, template, and outputdir use default values.
The outputdir can be an absolute path or relative to the current working directory.
Name and label are required.
visualforcecomponentname: name of the generated Visualforce component
MissingComponentnameFlag:
Missing required flag:
 -n, --componentname COMPONENTNAME  name of the generated Visualforce component
See more help with --help
VisualforcePageCommandDescription:
create a Visualforce page
If not supplied, the apiversion, template, and outputdir use default values.

Name and label are required.
visualforcepagename: name of the generated Visualforce page
